page.title: 15Fruit Farm - Costs & Grants
page.content: The complexity of building grant forms and the time taken to consider them deter many from even applying. In dry years irrigation is necessary, not only toensure that fruit reaches the E.E.C. minimum size but also to prevent Cox,in particular, from splitting. Over the last two very dry years irrigation of l inch/month has been carried out through a metered supply. In l984 over half-million gallons was put on the trees, costing Â£l.25 per l,000 gallons. A local beekeeper keeps 6 hives in the orchard all year ensuring pollination and the honey is sold through the farm shop. Customers for the shop come from Swansea to Manchester, but mostly from the Welsh valleys, loyally returning each year since l970.
